example-learning-objective.text: Prose we want to show up in the lesson.
example-learning-objective.assessment-rec: author notes about how it might be assessed

slope-from-points.text: Identify the slope and y-intercept of a linear relationship from two coordinates.
assessment-rec: 1 - Identify positive, negative and fractional slope from a table where x increases by 1.
2 - Identify positive, negative and fractional slope from a table where x increases by something other than 1.

slope-from-table.text: Identify the slope of a linear relationship from a table.
assessment-rec: 1 - Identify positive, negative and fractional slope from a table where x increases by 1.
2 - Identify positive, negative and fractional slope from a table where x increases by something other than 1.

slope-from-graph.text: Identify the slope of a linear relationship from a graph.
slope-from-graph.assessment-rec: Card sort connecting graphs to slopes

slope-from-def.text: Identify the slope of a linear relationship from a function definition.
assessment-rec: 1 - Identify the slope from a function definition in slope-intercept form.
2 - Identify the slope from a function definition in another form.

y-int-table.text: Identify the y-intercept of a linear relationship from a table.
assessment-rec: 1 - Identify the y-intercept from a table with x=0
2 - Identify the y-intercept from a table of a linear relationship without x=0

y-int-graph.text: Identify the y-intercept of a linear relationship from a graph.
y-int-graph.assessment-rec: Identify the y-intercept from a graph.

y-int-def.text: Identify the y-int of a linear relationship from a function definition.
assessment-rec: 1 - Identify both positive and negative slope from a definition in slope-intercept form
2 - Identify the slope from a definition in another form

linear-or-not-graph.text: Distinguish between linear and nonlinear relationships from graphs.

linear-or-not-table.text: Distinguish between linear and nonlinear relationships from tables.

linear-forms.text: Express linear equations in slope-intercept, point-slope, and standard forms and convert between these forms.

quadratics-graph.text: Graph quadratic functions and show intercepts, maxima, and minima.

quadratics-sequence.text: Quadratic sequences of numbers are characterized by the fact that the difference between terms always changes by the same amount.

quadratics-forms.text: Express quadratic equations in standard, factored, and vertex forms and convert between these forms.

ratio-visualize.text: Represent ratio relationships visually, using repeated images, scaled images, or area models.

distance-pythag.text: Explain how to derive the distance formula from the Pythagorean theorem.
